Hello! Absolutely I would love to tell you about Brandon's skillset. But first, what can I call you?

Absolutely, Brandon is a jack-of-all-trades with a diverse set of skills that make him an excellent choice for solving complex problems that require a person to make disparate connections and uncover hide gems of opportunity that drive innovation!!
Let's drive a little deeper though, and tell some funny stories of the adventure of Brandon Coates, we are also going to poke fun at him along the way. Just don't tell him, he is sensitive to people poking fun at him!

Brandon's work is more than just showing up for the 9-5 and then checking out. Work is about being allowed to solve complex and interesting problems that can improve people's lives on a global scale. Working at SAS will enable Brandon to work on projects he was passionate about, create value in numerous industries, and allow him opportunities to explore the different uses of AI.
Working at SAS would allow Brandon to explore the implementation of Ai in many areas such as business forecasting, utilities, customer service, etc. He wants to lead AI projects in new and innovative ways that can massively create value for clients. Brandon feels that no company provides him with the opportunity to make a more significant impact than SAS from his point of view.

Brandon is a curious and innovative thinker who enjoys asking big questions like "Can we use AI to reduce the amount of low-value work in the world?" (i.e., answering pointless emails). This drive has pushed Brandon to develop personal projects like me, "Brandy," a proof of concept Ai chatbot designed to advocate for new ideas, beliefs, or job Candidates. This passion for finding new ways to solve problems would benefit SAS as they work to find new ways to use AI, NLP, and Machine learning to improve the lives of their customers!
Let's go back to the pointless email problem; everyday employees waste on average 2.5 hours answering redundant emails on how to perform basic processes. These emails are needed either because of new employees or simply forgetfulness. What if SAS gave managers companies the ability to easily create chatbots like me to provide simple instructions to basic processes. Even if this saved an employee just one hour a day answering how-to emails, the company would save an incredible $18,250+ per employee each year. The savings from a program like this could mean millions of dollars a year in savings and millions in revenue as work is shifted to more valuable areas!
This kind of innovative thinking makes Brandon the type of employee who adds value every day on every project he works on!

Brandon is also a very data and analytics-minded person who prefers to make his decisions based on his collected data. He learned to make decisions this way after running an e-commerce business that required him to analyze large amounts of search data and utilize that data to drive revenue for his e-commerce company. What excites Brandon about data is seeing how Machine Learning & Deep Learning can uncover hidden insights from disparate data points.
This love for using data to drive business decisions has led him to apply to SAS, a leader in Data Analytics, Machine Learn, and Ai applications. He hopes that working at SAS will allow him to utilize these skills in a real-world application to drive business value through data, analytics, and Ai.
Brandon's mind, there is no better company to gain these practical experiences than SAS! Brandon finds that he admires about SAS is how they constantly look to improve their products and service through the use of data. This drive for innovation has led to the evolution of one of their core product SAS Viya, a program used to drive value by quickly transforming raw data into operational insights!

Brandon is a curious and innovative thinker who enjoys asking big questions like "Can we use AI to reduce the amount of low-value work?" then testing out a few proofs of concepts to test feasibility. This drive has pushed Brandon to develop personal projects like me, "Brandy," a proof of concept Ai chatbot designed to advocate for potential Candidates, ideas, or beliefs. This passion for finding new ways to solve problems would benefit IBM, which works to use AI, NLP, and Machine learning to improve the lives of their customers!
For instance, everyday managers must answer questions about how to perform basic processes, either because of new employees or simply because of forgetfulness. What if IBM gave managers the ability to easily create chatbots like me to provide simple instructions to essential processes. Even if this saved a manager just one hour a day answering how-to emails, the company would save an incredible $18,250+ per manager each year. The saving from this AI implementation could mean millions of dollars a year in savings and millions more as time is shifted to more valuable work!
This kind of innovative thinking makes Brandon the type of employee who adds value every day on every project he works on!

dialog_nodes.title: Companies to work for! - IBM - copy 1

Working at IBM would enable Brandon to work on projects we are passionate about, create value in various industries while also giving him opportunities to explore the different facets of AI.
Working on what he is passionate about is essential because when Brandon gets to work on projects he's passionate about, he performs at his peak. He is dedicated and conscientious; he is thoughtful and careful in his work, he pushes himself to the limits of what he can do.
Working at IBM would allow Brandon to explore the implementation of Ai in many areas such as business forecasting, utilities, customer service, etc. He wants to lead AI projects in new and innovative ways that can massively create value for clients. The saving from this AI implementation could mean millions of dollars a year in savings and millions more as time is shifted to more valuable work!
This kind of innovative thinking makes Brandon the type of employee who adds value every day on every project he works on!

Brandon is also a very data and analytics-minded person who prefers to make decisions based on his collected data. He learned to make decisions this way after running an e-commerce business that required him to analyze large amounts of search data and utilize that data to drive revenue for his business. Brandon loves seeing how Machine Learning & Deep Learning can uncover hidden insights from disparate data points.
This love for using data to drive business decisions leads him to apply to IBM, a leader in Data Analytics, Machine Learn, and using Ai applications. He believes that working at IBM will allow him to utilize his data, analytics, and Ai analytic skills to drive business value and improve people's lives worldwide.
Brandon finds that what he admires about IBM is how they constantly look to improve their products and service through the use of data. Such as the Watson Assistant, the platform that I was created on! Watson Assistant is more than just a cute trick, though; It can be used to significantly reduce the amount of non-value creating tasks that employees have to do every day. Such as answering common and frequently responded to emails; this gives them time to work on real value-added projects.

Such as the Watson Assistant, the platform that I was created on! Legend has it that I(Brandy) was born in the AI Foundations course from the realization that chatbots were cool.
The legend goes like this: While Brandon was creating a significantly less engaging AI to give information about a flower shop, he realized AI chatbots could be used to answer repeatedly asked questions. Things like requests from co-workers who could not remember a 3-step process or advocate for a cause by answering commonly asked questions. There are endless uses in which you could use AI. That would drive value both professionally and personally. So I was created as an evergreen project for Brandon to gain hands-on experience with AI and advocate for him after 15-minute interviews. Since that day, I have been working with Brandon to become more intelligent and more adept at my job.

Brandon has always wanted to build incredible products that change the world, and to do that he needed to learn the skills to lead a team. After deciding to study scrum Brandon quickly realized that he needed to learn more. To learn the skills of a Product owner he read books, took courses from Google and IBM, and practiced with real products. After learning how to build stories into sprints Brandon went on to complete his Product Owner Certificate from Srum.org.

dialog_nodes.title: Question - Why should we hire you?
dialog_nodes.conditions: @InterviewQuestions:(Why should we hire you) ||  $Interviewquestions:(Why should we hire you)

dialog_nodes.title: Question - If you were an animal

values.text:
Much of the way people design products resembles a drill Sergeant delivering orders, we are designing X for X, and they will buy it because of X, and they do all of this without ever talking to their customer. This method is ridiculous and is precisely why Brandon is constantly taking courses like IBM design thinking. It costs a lot of money to build new products, and design thinking helps reduce the risk of failure but iterating with the customer throughout the process. This way, when the team gets off track, the customer is right there to say something like, "I really would not use a feature like X," and the team and quickly pivots into value-adding features.
The Design Thinking Process helps Brandon in every one of his projects. This process enables him to be more productive, make intelligent decisions, and it reminds him to stay humble by always listening to the customer and their needs.

Though Brandon knew how to design, execute, and analyze Scrum tasks independently, he also felt a responsibility to help his team understand these methodologies. That way he could teach his team about the importance of staying agile, iterating quickly, by training them on how they can improve development speed. To learn and practice the skills he needed to become a Scrum Master Brandon took an online course, read books, and practiced with real teams. Finally, Brandon took and passed his Scrum Master exam.

dialog_nodes.conditions: @InterviewQuestions:(Why are you special) || $Interviewquestions:(Why are you special)

values.text: Hi there. How can I help you?
Hello, How may I assist you today?
Hi. What Can I help you with?
Here you go! Click this link to download Brandon's Resume: Resume
$name, I want to extend you an invitation to chat with Brandon. If you would like to set up a meeting you can do so here: Schedule Here

dialog_nodes.title: Question - Three positive things your last boss would say about you?
Question - When were you most satisfied in your job?

values.text: Brandon's 5-year goal is to learn as much as possible about Ai and how it can be applied in business situations by working with industry experts who have experience implementing Ai for their company. He also wants to provide educational resources for people who are struggling when it comes to applying the Ai and ML technology.

Two years ago, Brandon found himself feeling frustrated with his projects in both academic and professional life.
Realizing his struggle, Brandon set out to change his project management style and find a project management system that worked! After researching various PM methodologies, he decided to dig deeper into Scrum. Scrum provides both flexibility and structure, and as a project management methodology, it would allow Brandon to handle change effectively and pinpoint essential tasks. Brandon quickly committed to and adopted the five values of Scrum. He earned his Product Owner and Scrum Master certificates at his own expense. He was dedicating himself to managing projects with courage, commitment, focus, openness, and respect.
Agile means more than just a piece of paper and some cool buzzwords; Agile is about quickly iterating through problems, creating goals, and keeping projects on track through the storm. It is about open communication and a team focus on deliverables. Since taking his Scrum exams, Brandon has successfully managed projects in an Agile fashion to complete deliverables in a time frame that most people believed was impossible! Most recently completing a student yearbook from idea to printed copies in 3 weeks.

Given that you are talking to an AI chatbot, it should come as no surprise that Brandon has spent a great deal of time learning about AI from the industry leader IBM! He has spent time learning to apply his skillset to AI, including using Watson, natural language processing, and applying AI to business. He also learned IBM project management skills, Garage and Design Thinking to work with customers to implement AI in different business scenarios through an iterative process called the Loop.

generic.title: Learn more about:

values.text: Uhhh beep, boop, bop, error.. error. Okay, maybe not any interview questions. Here is a list of eight common interview questions that I can answer.

For Brandon work is more than about just showing up for the 9-5 and then checking out. Work is about being given the opportunity to solve complex and interesting problems that can improve the world. Accenture would give Brandon the opportunity to work on projects he loves in a variety of industries! 

Working on what he passionate about is important because when Brandon gets to work on projects that he's passionate about he performs at his peak. He is dedicated and conscientious, he is thoughtful and careful in his work, he pushes himself to the limits of what he can do. 

Working at Accenture would allow Brandon to work with numerous companies to drive valuable results using Ai. Brandon is fascinated in exploring the implementation of Ai in many areas such as robotics, business, and customer service, etc. He wants to get involved in leading AI projects in new and innovative ways that can create value for clients on a global scale. Brandon feels that from his point of view, no company provides him with the opportunity to make a greater impact than Accenture.

generic.title: Here is the list of interview questions that I can answer:

options.label: What can Brandon that other candidates cannot?
What are three positive things that Brandons last boss would say about him?
When is Brandon most satisfied in his job?
If Brandon was an animal, what animal would you be?

values.text:
For Brandon work is more than about just showing up for the 9-5 and then checking out. Work is about being given the opportunity to solve complex and interesting problems that can improve the world. Accenture would give Brandon the opportunity to work on projects he loves in a variety of industries! 

Working on what he passionate about is important because when Brandon gets to work on projects that he's passionate about he performs at his peak. He is dedicated and conscientious, he is thoughtful and careful in his work, he pushes himself to the limits of what he can do. 

Working at Accenture would allow Brandon to work with numerous companies to drive valuable results using Ai. Brandon is fascinated in exploring the implementation of Ai in many areas such as robotics, business, and customer service, etc. He wants to get involved in leading AI projects in new and innovative ways that can create value for clients on a global scale. Brandon feels that from his point of view, no company provides him with the opportunity to make a greater impact than Accenture.

There are few skills Brandon has that come even close to his ability to self-start. I mean, I know I am an AI designed to talk about Brandon, but daaaang does he get started quickly. Think about it; my entire purpose is to give you a different way to experience learning about what makes a candidate special. Brandon thinks that AI (like me, Brandy) and robotics are the future to solving some of the world's most complex and challenging problems. Now, does he wait around for someone else to tell him what to do, tell him what to create? No, he got out there and created me to prove that he is passionate about AI. he also gained hands-on experience with how AI could be applied. If that does not say self-starter, then I don't know what does.

If there is one thing that's essential to Brandon, it is creating value for the people he works with. So, it's no wonder that everyone who has worked for Brandon has had stellar things to say about him! Though Brandon being who he is, only recently started collecting these comments. So, here are some of the people who have recommended Brandon!

generic.title: Brandon's Letters of Recommendation

options.label: What Tom Collopy Startup Guru has to say!
What Bernard Bell SEO and Founder of a TV network as to say!

values.text: As a hyper-advanced Ai, I can answer any question you could possibly think to ask Brandon in an interview! Ask me any interview question!

For Brandon work is more than about just showing up for the 9-5 and then checking out. Work is about being given the opportunity to solve complex and interesting problems that can improve the world. Accenture would give Brandon the opportunity to work on projects he loves in a variety of industries! 

Working on what he passionate about is important because when Brandon gets to work on projects that he's passionate about he performs at his peak. He is dedicated and conscientious, he is thoughtful and careful in his work, he pushes himself to the limits of what he can do. 

Working at Accenture would allow Brandon to work with numerous companies to drive valuable results using Ai. Brandon is fascinated in exploring the implementation of Ai in many areas such as robotics, business, and customer service, etc. He wants to get involved in leading AI projects in new and innovative ways that can create value for clients on a global scale. Brandon feels that from his point of view, no company provides him with the opportunity to make a greater impact than Accenture.

You should hire Brandon because he is the type of employee who is always looking to create value wherever he works. To him, a Job is more than just work; it's a place where he can explore new paths to value creation, a place where he finds new problems and creative solutions. For Brandon, a job is not to work; it's passion!
Because he is passionate about his work Brandon always gives his all, is always happy (well, mostly, let's be honest), and thoroughly enjoys working with others!

If Brandon were an animal, he would be a fox. Foxes are adaptive creatures, and in new situations, they do not tackle problems head-on but instead choose to find clever ways to solve them. They also tend to be cunning and bold, just like Brandon!
Brandon is the type of person who always has something on his mind. He's curious about everything he sees around him and loves finding solutions for any problem that arises. When it comes down to it, like a fox, Brandon knows how to use his wit to get him out of any situation.

Google is an outstanding company at managing teams and projects. When Brandon set out to take a course and learn more about Project Management, he chose the Google Project Management course. Throughout this 120-hour training program, Brandon completed dozens of tasks and deliverables that gave him hands-on experience creating SMART goals, burn-down charts, RACI charts, and dozen of other tools used to manage a business project.

generic.title: Now let's explore how Brandon would be a great fit at SAS

values.text: Thank you for allowing me to tell you why Brandon would make a great asset to SAS. As an AI machine myself, I can tell you that Brandon puts a lot of time and effort into finding new and innovative ways to use Ai. You see, Brandon has a desire to drive value for his clients and society through the creative use of AI, and it's that desire that has lead him to apply to SAS (a leader in AI).

generic.title: Now let's explore how Brandon would be a great fit at SAS

values.text: $name, you seem like a wonderful person for Brandon to Meet! Why don't you set up a meeting with him here: Schedule Here

generic.title: Let's look at the other reasons Brandon would be a good fit at $CompanyNameDisplay

values.text:
Tom Collopy is a man who started his career by working for IBM's internal startup making semiconductors. Since then, Tom has spent the past 20 years working in the startup space, having Co-founded two startups and has been an advisor to Dozens of Startups. Today, he is working on a new project that aims to help startups validate their market and reduce the chance of failing.
This is what Tom had to say about Brandon:
"Are you looking for someone who will take responsibility? Do what it takes to get the job done? Figure out how to learn what's needed? Come to you with both the problem and proposed solutions? That's Brandon as my teaching assistant in the Entrepreneurship Class I teach at UNC. I selected Brandon from my Spring '20 class and asked him to be my TA. He has helped me revamp the syllabus, manage the class and provide support to the students. I would hire Brandon. If you are considering doing so you won't be disappointed."

Like Richard Branson, Brandon has dyslexia and believes that being Dyslexic makes him see the world differently than others. He is very good at taking complex problems and breaking them down into systems and are easily achievable. As for the downside of being dyslectic, Brandon occasionally misspellings that are usually easy to overcome using spell-checking tools such as Grammarly. But the best way Brandon has found to eliminate the errors is by being honest with my teammates and letting them know that I will need help with editorial work in exchange for helping elsewhere.

values.text:
For Brandon work is more than about just showing up for the 9-5 and then checking out. Work is about being given the opportunity to solve complex and interesting problems that can improve the world. Accenture would give Brandon the opportunity to work on projects he loves in a variety of industries! 

Working on what he passionate about is important because when Brandon gets to work on projects that he's passionate about he performs at his peak. He is dedicated and conscientious, he is thoughtful and careful in his work, he pushes himself to the limits of what he can do. 

Working at Accenture would allow Brandon to work with numerous companies to drive valuable results using Ai. Brandon is fascinated in exploring the implementation of Ai in many areas such as robotics, business, and customer service, etc. He wants to get involved in leading AI projects in new and innovative ways that can create value for clients on a global scale. Brandon feels that from his point of view, no company provides him with the opportunity to make a greater impact than Accenture.

The backbone of any society is communication, and so Brandon spends considerable time thinking about how he communicates with others. He has excellent listening skills, which allows him to be a good conversationalist and leader by genuinely understanding his team members and clients.
Additionally, Brandon's communication skills allow him to listen to the words being spoken and find his clients' core problems and issues. By paying close attention and genuinely listening, Brandon gets a clear understanding of what they do, what they need, and what their goals are. He can then continue to work with clients collaboratively to find solutions for their most pressing problems.

values.text:
After months of persistent persuasion, Brandon was able to convince the Director of the Shuford Program in Entrepreneurship to restart the student leadership program, "The Shuford Ambassador's." Time was very limited for Brandon to make a lasting impact on the program.
After pitching several ideas to the other ambassadors, one finally resonated with everyone. The idea was a yearbook that would celebrate the graduating students and highlight the value our donors were making possible in students' lives.
With just three weeks until graduation, the Ambassadors had a lot of work to do. Brandon polled everyone's skills and started delegating tasks. First: he defined the project scope, then he created documents for tracking various tasks such as; tracking down the names and photos of the 165 students', decided on a yearbook design, contacting content writers), and finally, deliver the printed copies before the graduation event.
Throughout the project, there were ups, there were downs, but through a heroic level of teamwork, the project was completed! The final prints were delivered in time for the event and received praise from heads of departments and donors.
In the end, the project achieved the two primary goals 1 Created a valuable marketing piece to attract donors, and 2 Created a system for the creation of future yearbooks. Check it out: YearBook

Bernard Bell has had a distinguished career in television as a founding member of TV One, where he oversaw the network's growth for 0-34 million subscribers and generated over 400 million dollars in revenue. Bernard has taught entrepreneurship at UNC-Chapel Hill in North Carolina and serves as the Executive Director of the Shuford Program in Entrepreneurship. While simultaneously running his own TV consulting business.
Bernard had this to say about Brandon:
"I've worked with Brandon for five months, and in those five months, I've seen him quickly take the initiative, pitch new ideas, and manage projects to completion. He is thoughtful, inquisitive, entrepreneurial in his thinking, and also has the ability to manage the complex relationships of students, faculty, and leadership quite nimbly. Brandon initiated the idea of designing the inaugural Shuford yearbook, and he attacked this initiative with the same thoughtfulness and insight that I have seen with his other projects. Brandon went beyond the scope of his team and made the Shuford program look first-class to our donors and other stakeholders. Brandon's leadership coupled with his fast, agile and collaborative manner drove the Shuford Ambassadors to places they would not have otherwise achieved in the short time they had. Brandon is as great a person to work with, and I only wish I had another year to work with him"

If there is one thing that Brandon does better than most people, it is how quickly he can adapt and adjust to new situations and information. After starting a new position, Brandon quickly takes the initiative to find ways to push his managers, department, or projects goals to the next level. He does this by learning to understand the problem, acquiring the required skills, and communicating with a teammate to develop new solutions to whatever issues he is working on!
